Material used.Description: Transgenic mice expressing human mutant (A30P) α-synuclein were generated.

Readout description.Result Description: Expression of human mutant (A30P) α-synuclein led to a strong somatic accumulation in the olfactory bulb and reduced levels of dopamine and metabolites.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were conducted on multiple mice.

Technical replicates.Description: Multiple measurements were taken for each sample.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mice were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic mice were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t test for pairwise comparisons with post hoc Newman Keuls test

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Dopamine levels within the range observed in control mice.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Dopamine levels significantly lower than those in control mice.

Material used.Description: Transgenic mice expressing human mutant (A30P) α-synuclein were generated.

Readout description.Result Description: Mice expressing human mutant (A30P) α-synuclein showed hyperactivity under novelty and stress conditions.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were conducted on multiple mice.

Technical replicates.Description: Multiple trials were conducted for each mouse.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mice were used as positive controls.

Basic negative control.Description: Non-transgenic mice were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Two-tailed t test for pair-wise comparisons

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Normal activity levels as observed in control mice.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Increased activity levels under novelty and stress conditions.
